ARABIC: بَرَآءَةٌ مِّنَ ٱللَّهِ وَرَسُولِهِۦٓ إِلَى ٱلَّذِينَ عَٰهَدتُّم مِّنَ ٱلْمُشْرِكِينَ

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: An announcement to those mushrikun you have a general treaty with that Allah and His Messenger are free of them:
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: IMMUNITY is granted those idolaters by God and his Apostle with whom you have a treaty.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: This is a declaration of disavowal by Allah and His Messenger to those who associate others with Allah in His Divinity and with whom you have made treaties:
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: God and His Messenger declare the abrogation of the peace treaty that existed between them and the pagans.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: Severance of ties is proclaimed by Allah and on behalf of His Noble Messenger, towards the polytheists with whom you had a treaty.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: Freedom from (all) obligations (is declared) from Allah and His Messenger () to those of the Mushrikin (idolaters), with whom you made a treaty.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: (This is a declaration of) immunity by Allah and His Apostle towards those of the idolaters with whom you made an agreement.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: An acquittal, from God and His Messenger, unto the idolaters with whom you made covenant:
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: Freedom from obligation (is proclaimed) from Allah and His messenger toward those of the idolaters with whom ye made a treaty.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: This is a declaration of immunity from God and His Messenger to the polytheists, with whom you had made agreements.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: Quittance is this from Allah and His aposle unto the associators with whom ye had covenanted.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: [This is] a [declaration of] repudiation by Allah and His Apostle [addressed] to the polytheists with whom you had made a treaty:
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: A (declaration) of immunity from Allah and His Messenger, to those of the Pagans with whom ye have contracted mutual alliances:-
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: Freedom from (all) obligations (is declared) from Allah and His Messenger (SAW) to those of the Mushrikun (polytheists, pagans, idolaters, disbelievers in the Oneness of Allah), with whom you made a treaty.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: An acquittal from Allah and His Messenger to the idolaters with whom you have made agreements;
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: A declaration of immunity from God and His Messenger to the polytheists with whom you had made a treaty.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: [This is a declaration of] disassociation, from Allah and His Messenger, to those with whom you had made a treaty among the polytheists.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [9:1]   This is: A declaration of immunity from God and His Messenger to, reach, the idolaters with whom you made a pact, a pact for an indefinite period of time, or one for [a period of] less than, or more than, four months; the annulment of the pact shall be as God mentions in His saying:
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: And from his narration on the authority of Ibn 'Abbas who said regarding Allah's saying: (Freedom from obligation): '(Freedom from obligation) this is freedom from obligation (from Allah and His messenger towards those of the idolaters with whom ye made a treaty) but then they broke that treaty; freedom from obligation is the breaking of treaties. Allah says: whosoever has a treaty with the Messenger of Allah (pbuh) let him know that it is broken. Some of them had a treaty lasting four months, and some of more nine months, while others had treaties for longer or shorter periods. Others had no treaty with Allah's Messenger at all. All these treaties were broken except for the treaty with the Banu Kinanah which was for nine months. Whoever had a treaty for more or less than four months, their treaties were ratified to last four month beginning from the day of immolation; and whoever had a treaty of four months, that treaty was ratified to last four months beginning from the day of immolation. Those who had a treaty of nine months, their treaties were left as they were, while those who did not sign any treaty, were granted one of 50 days beginning from the day of immolation until the departure of the person who was in a state of ritual consecration:
